Job Title: Commercial Financial Analyst - West Pennant Hills or Bathurst
Ad Text:
Why grow your career with Forestry Corporation of NSW:

At Forestry Corporation of NSW, our values are at the heart of everything that we do. We hope you share our values of:




Wellbeing: Everyone home, injury free, everyday
Respect: We care for country, community, and ourselves
Integrity: We are honest and accountable
Innovation: We challenge ourselves to think differently, be bold and continuously improve







The Opportunity
We have an excellent opportunity for a collaborative and analytical finance professional to join our Softwood Plantations Division as Commercial Finance Analyst.

In this valued role, you’ll work closely with the Commercial Finance Manager and regional teams across Bathurst, Grafton and Walcha to provide thoughtful financial insights, analysis and guidance. Your work will help shape informed decisions that support the sustainable performance of Forestry Corporation’s softwood operations.

This position suits someone who enjoys building relationships, making sense of data, and contributing to continuous improvement in how financial information supports the business.


What we can offer you

Full-time, permanent opportunity
Flexible work options to support work-life balance
Opportunities for ongoing professional development
Work for an organisation that values sustainability, integrity and innovation
Inclusive and supportive team culture where everyone’s contribution counts
Employee referral program rewarding successful hires
Competitive salary and benefits




  

About the role

As Commercial Finance Analyst, you’ll partner with the Commercial Finance Manager and divisional leaders to provide clear and practical financial advice that supports business planning and decision-making. You’ll take a hands-on role in month-end analysis, budgeting and forecasting, helping translate complex financial data into meaningful insights.




A key part of your work will be supporting the Division with accurate and timely reporting, while finding opportunities to improve the clarity and usefulness of management information. You’ll collaborate closely with Corporate Finance to ensure consistent reporting standards, identify and assess financial risks and opportunities, and help strengthen financial understanding across the business. Building strong, trusted relationships with colleagues will be central to your success, as you work together to deliver high-quality financial outcomes for Forestry Corporation’s Softwood Division.







About you
You’re a motivated and organised finance professional who values teamwork and accuracy. You enjoy using your analytical skills to help others make well-informed decisions, and you bring a calm, thoughtful approach to problem-solving.


You’ll also have:

A relevant tertiary qualification in Accounting or Business, and CPA/CA membership (or working towards it).
Experience in management accounting, financial analysis, budgeting and forecasting.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and strong attention to detail.
The ability to explain financial information in a clear and supportive way.
A genuine interest in improving processes and finding better ways of working together.







 

For further information about the role please contact Rob Brisot, Commercial Finance Manager, on:  0428 484 153



If you’re looking for a role where your financial insights truly make a difference, we’d love to hear from you.

 

APPLICATIONS CLOSE:  SUNDAY 23 NOVEMBER @ 11:59PM AEDT

Location: Sydney (preferred), Brisbane or Melbourne 

Type: 12 month fixed-term contract 

Hybrid role, happy to talk flexible working 

Click here to discover what it's like to be a part of QBE Group   

The opportunity 

As the Catastrophe Research Manager, you will play a crucial role in enhancing our organization's understanding and management of risks associated with natural disasters. In this role you will manage QBE's catastrophe model validation pipeline and add value to QBE's View of Risk by bringing innovative insight through additional data sources. 

Your new role 

Manage QBE's catastrophe model evaluation pipeline to maintain QBE's View of Risk with priorities and timelines agreed with the Group Head of Catastrophe Modelling Research and other Group and Divisional stakeholders. 

Project manage and perform individual catastrophe model evaluations in accordance with the catastrophe model validation best practice in agreed timeframes. 

Manage catastrophe modelling requirements with GSSC team including quality and timeliness. 

Maintain and improve catastrophe model validation best practice. 

Add insight and value to QBE's model evaluations through leading projects on innovative use of claims data and sourcing of relevant hazard, vulnerability and loss data. 

Work with a range of internal and external stakeholders to add value to QBE's View of Risk, including Divisional teams, model vendors, brokers, academics and consultants. 

Adhere to Group Risk and other regulatory requirements and capacity to work with these stakeholders to codevelop appropriate solutions. 

About you 

Demonstrable experience in a similar role alongside a PhD, Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science, Physical Geography, Meteorology, Flood Engineering or Atmospheric Sciences. 

Strong analytical and quantitative skills with a keen attention to detail. 

Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. 

Team management and training skills including experience/comfort in managing offshore resources. 

Extensive technical skills in catastrophe modelling software such as RMS, Verisk and Impact Forecasting Elements. 

Recognised subject matter expertise and deep interest in natural hazards including cyclones, floods, bushfire, earthquake and storms, catastrophe risk, re/insurance. 




About QBE 

We can never really predict what’s around the corner, but at QBE we’re asking the right questions to enable a more resilient future – helping those around us build strength and embrace change to their advantage. We’re an international insurer that’s building momentum towards realising our vision of becoming the most consistent and innovative risk partner.  

And our people will be at the centre of our success. We’re proud to work together, and encourage each other enable resilience for our customers, our environment, our economies and our communities. With more than more than 13,000 people working across 26 countries, we’re big enough to make a real impact, but small enough to provide a friendly workplace, where people are down-to-earth, passionate and kind.  

We believe this is our moment – what if it was yours too? Your career at QBE — let’s make it happen! 

Benefits 

We offer a range of benefits to help provide holistic support for your work life, whatever your circumstances. As a QBE employee you will have access to and benefit from: 

‘Hybrid Working’ – a mix of working from home and in the office to enhance your work/life balance 

Life Leave, supporting the life events we all experience, leaving your annual leave for rest 

Free holistic wellbeing coaching, nutritional, confidential counselling, financial and legal advice 

18 weeks’ gender-equal flexible leave for all new parents, including paid super 

Voluntary super contributions and company matching 

Income protection insurance & reimbursed Death and Total Permanent Disability insurance premiums 

A range of discounts on insurance products, car hire, hotels, goods and services 

Rewards & Recognition 

We value our employee’s experience with us and are proud to have been recognised for the following awards: 

2025 Winner of Excellence in Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Award at the Insurance Business Australia Awards for our Respect@QBE program 

2023 Most Inclusive Workplace at the Australian HR Institute (AHRI) Awards  

2021 LinkedIn Top Employer & HRD Employer of Choice 

2020 Best Workplace Diversity & Inclusion and Excellence Award for Best Health & Wellbeing at the Australian HR Awards 

Platinum employer on the Australian Workplace Equality Index (AWEI) – the definitive national benchmark on LGBTQI+ workplace inclusion 

Ranked in the top ten in the AAGE Top Graduate Employers 2025 for medium sized program as voted by graduates 

Family Friendly Workplace accredited employer since 2021 




Apply now 

APPLY NOW and let’s make it happen!  

Click APPLY to submit your application. Successful applicants will need to complete work rights, police and credit checks through our online provider as a condition of employment.  

QBE recognise the value of diverse perspectives and experience. We are committed to an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected for who they are. If we can provide support with access requirements, alternative work arrangements or you would like to connect with one of our networks please contact us at recruitment@qbe.com

Job Title: Business Profit Growth Analyst for Building Indus
Ad Text:
About Founders Edge

Founders Edge partners with established SME business owners (typically $1M–$10M+ in annual revenue) to help them scale with strategic precision and confidence. Our programs blend board-level strategy, financial modelling, and growth mentorship to help founders achieve extraordinary results — both in business and life.

The Role

We’re looking for a commercially savvy Business Analyst who can turn strategy into numbers — someone who thrives on mapping out how a business can grow over a 10-year horizon using leverage points such as pricing, lead generation, conversion rates, margins, capacity, and team structure.

You’ll work closely with our founder Ryll Burgin-Doyle and our coaching team to create and refine Revenue Resource Maps — dynamic spreadsheets that show business owners exactly how strategic tweaks compound into millions in additional profit and long-term value.

This role requires not just financial skill, but rapport, insight, and curiosity — the ability to engage with SME owners, understand their business model, and translate conversations into clear financial scenarios.

Key Responsibilities

Build and refine 10-year financial growth models (“Revenue Resource Maps”) tailored to each client’s business.



Work with coaches and clients to identify key leverage points for growth (pricing, margins, team utilisation, lead generation, etc.).



Translate qualitative strategy into quantitative outcomes (e.g., revenue targets, profit trajectories, team structure impacts).



Present findings in an engaging, plain-English way — bridging the gap between data and decision-making.



Ensure accuracy, clarity, and alignment with Founders Edge frameworks.



Contribute to ongoing refinement of the Revenue Resource Map templates and systems.



About You

Strong background in financial analysis, business modelling, or commercial advisory — ideally with SME experience (not just corporate).



Comfortable working directly with business owners and senior leaders.



Excellent communication and interpersonal skills — you can make numbers engaging and relevant.



You are excellent at working with Excel/Google Sheets skills; bonus if you can build or improve dynamic models.



Commercial understanding of growth drivers in service-based businesses (particularly building/construction, trade services, or professional services).



Highly organised, detail-oriented, and deadline-driven.



Strategic thinker who understands how to connect operational levers to long-term value creation.



Preferred Background

Experience in SME consulting, business coaching, or fractional CFO/Financial Controller roles.



Prior work in the building, construction, or trade services sector highly regarded.



Exposure to business strategy frameworks and business-growth models a plus.



What You’ll Get

Work directly with a world-class business strategist and her team.



Meaningful, high-impact work helping entrepreneurs grow and thrive.



Flexibility to work remotely, part-time, or full-time (depending on experience).



Competitive compensation with opportunity for ongoing engagement.




You’ll be part of a fast moving, fast growing company that is all about changing lives, transforming businesses and making a difference. We care for our clients deeply and each other. 




Payment:  Generous Hourly Contract Rate Based on Experience. 

Your Next Steps: 




To apply please send your resume and a short video explaining why you would be a great fit for this role through to ja@foundersedgehq.com

Company description:



At Stockland we are a community delivering outcomes that benefit the community at large. We work collaboratively and inclusively, building strong working relationships. Our portfolio is diverse and so are the opportunities for professional and career development. We are committed to providing our people with broad experiences to build a successful career.





Job description:



An exciting opportunity for an Analyst with superior quantitative and financial skills has arisen, based in the Sydney Head Office. Reporting into the Head of Mergers & Acquisitions, this is a key role contributing to Stockland's strategic objectives through analysis and execution of capital markets transactions including mergers, acquisitions, capital partnerships and divestments.




The Opportunity




Your daily responsibilities will include:

Undertake portfolio analysis, valuation and modelling of prospective mergers, acquisitions, capital partnerships and divestments

Assist with preparation of presentations and board papers including coordination with other contributors

Assist in coordinating due diligence with internal and external advisors

Engage and collaborate with key internal customers and stakeholders to build and maintain strong working relationships and drive positive business outcomes

Engage with external advisors to build and maintain strong working relationships and drive positive business outcomes.

Implement stakeholder relationship management initiatives as agreed.

Promote and contribute to a highly collaborative and inclusive team.

Evaluate CR&S and HS&E implications in all capital transaction opportunities.

Implement and participate in corporate initiatives (e.g. volunteering etc).

Act ethically and responsibly with all parties in completing transactions.




About You




University degree qualified - preferably including capital markets or corporate finance with a strong quantitative component (Essential)

Relevant experience in roles in finance or real estate (Desirable)

Advanced analytical, modelling and numerical skills and strong Excel skills

Strong written and verbal communication skills, with high attention to detail




The Stockland Proposition




At Stockland we are a community delivering outcomes that benefit the community at large. We work collaboratively and inclusively, building strong working relationships. Our portfolio is diverse and so are the opportunities for professional and career development. We are committed to providing our people with broad experiences to build a successful career.




Stockland has a strong commitment to achieving the best outcomes through an inclusive and collaborative culture. Our customers come from diverse backgrounds and we want our teams to reflect this.




We offer competitive remuneration and benefits. Benefits include free to access or subsidised lifestyle, health, well-being and financial services products.




Due to the permanent nature of this role, we can only accept applications from Australian Citizens, Permanent Residents or Open Work Visa holders with more than 12 months validity from their role start date.




Apply today - Stockland - it's your place.




Agencies should note that unsolicited resumes will not be accepted for this position and Stockland will not pay any fees related to resumes that are submitted directly to hiring managers and not through our approved process. Where appropriate, the Careers @ Stockland Team will work with our preferred panel of agencies to source candidates for roles. Please submit any queries relating to the approved process of submitting candidate resumes or Stockland's preferred agency panel to careers@stockland.com.au

Job Title: Senior Investment Analyst - Fixed Income, Credit and Cash
Category: Corporate Finance & Investment Banking (Banking & Financial Services)
Ad Text:
We’re representing a leading large funds management organisation with a high-performing, collegiate investments team managing diversified portfolios across domestic and global markets.
  
Reporting to a top-tier investment leader, this role sits within the Fixed Income, Credit and Cash team and will focus on analytical oversight, performance monitoring, and investment reporting across global and domestic credit markets.
  
�� The Opportunity
- Analyse and monitor external managers across credit and fixed income mandates
- Provide performance attribution, reporting and market intelligence
- Collaborate with investment operations, performance and risk teams on liquidity, compliance and portfolio analytics
- Gain exposure across sovereign bonds, macro and liquidity management, and asset allocation processes
- Contribute to due diligence, research and modelling supporting investment decisions
  
�� About You
- 5–7 years’ experience across institutional investing, consulting, asset management or credit ratings
- Strong analytical and quantitative aptitude
- Sound knowledge of fixed income and credit markets (sovereign, corporate or hybrid)
- Excellent communication skills and stakeholder management
  
  
Total package: circa $200K, including super, with annual reviews based on performance.
  
This is an opportunity to join a high-calibre investment team known for its analytical rigour, collaborative culture and exposure to sophisticated institutional portfolios.
  
If you’re ready to leverage your credit and fixed income expertise within a large, values-driven investment business — reach out for a confidential discussion.

schenuk.wijesekera@perigongroup.com.au
  
#Investments #FixedIncome #CreditMarkets #FundsManagement #CFA #FinanceJobs #SydneyJobs #InstitutionalInvesting #PerigonGroup

Category:
Analysis & Reporting (Banking & Financial Services)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Are you an experienced finance leader ready to drive corporate management accounting and performance reporting across Queensland Health? Step into the role of Director, Analysis in Finance Branch and drive expert insights, lead a high-performing team, and champion greater transparency. Benefit from flexible work arrangements, professional growth opportunities, and the chance to make a meaningful impact.

What you'll do

Co-ordinate and complete effective executive reporting, including identifing significant variations and trends across Queensland Health.
Provide high quality advice, information and guidance to Executive Management, HHSs and Divisions, particularly in relation to financial analysis and management.
Proactively identify business improvement opportunities and recommend strategies to realise the benefits.
Ensure that systems are established and maintained to provide budget transparency and forecasting integrity.
Lead and promote a professional and responsive team to meet the information and financial management advice needs of health services.

About you

We are searching for someone with:

Accounting qualifications and membership of a recognised professional accounting body.
Demonstrated ability to provide effective leadership and management at a senior level within a service delivery organisation involving multi-disciplinary programs and diverse work units.
High-level knowledge of financial management legislation relevant to Queensland Health.
Highly developed communication and interpersonal competence, including the capacity to negotiate, resolve conflict and positively influence and motivate others in a significant environment of reform and change.
Well-developed skills, including high level ability in the areas of planning, managing resources, budget preparation and management, project management, objective setting and monitoring, coaching and performance feedback and management.
Proven issue identification, analytical and research skills, problem solving skills and a demonstrated ability to develop innovative, sensitive and practical solutions and provide strategic advice to complex issues.
Understanding of the financial pressures and constraints that impact service delivery and the capacity to recommend courses of action which achieve optimal outcomes within those constraints.

Why work with us?

Work alongside passionate professionals in a supportive and inclusive environment that values people and prioritises employee success and wellbeing. This includes

Competitive salaries

12.75% superannuation
17.5% leave loading

Employee wellbeing

38 hour full time work week
Access to 24/7 confidential employee support providers and counsellors including for immediate family members
Additional flexibility to support your work life balance including access to generous leave entitlements, such as purchased leave, domestic violence leave, reproductive health leave, cultural leave, study and examination leave.

Professional development

Career progression with more than 300 diverse career pathways and career support to take you further!
Access to a variety of programs and initiatives to support training and career growth.
Grow your skills through hands-on experience and access to internal training opportunities and additional financial and leave benefits for approved external training and development.

Our commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion 

At Queensland Health, our work environment is inclusive and supportive, and we value our employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from people of all cultures, abilities and backgrounds.

Our commitment to cultural safety, equity, diversity and inclusion means we understand some people may need changes to the recruitment process. If you need support during the recruitment process, such as meeting with the panel virtually instead of in person, please reach out to the hiring manager. We value diverse candidates and your need for adjustments will not affect our hiring decisions. 

Ready to apply?

For further information on how to apply please review the attached Role Description.

Applications will remain current for a period of up to 12 months and may be considered for other vacancies which may include an alternative employment basis such as temporary, full time or part time.
